headline: IYZ: Concentrated Telco ETF, Hard To See The Upside
summary: IYZ underperforms both its peer XTL and the S&P 500, with disappointing returns and unattractive projected industry growth. Read more on why I do not recommend IYZ.

headline: Comcast to Participate in Goldman Sachs Investor Conference
summary: PHILADELPHIA, August 19, 2025--Comcast Corporation (Nasdaq: CMCSA) announced that on Tuesday, September 9, 2025, Mike Cavanagh, President of Comcast Corporation, will participate in the Goldman Sachs Communacopia + Technology Conference.

headline: Nexstar to buy Tegna, owner of Cleveland’s WKYC, in $3.54B deal to expand TV reach
summary: Nexstar is acquiring Tegna, parent of Cleveland’s WKYC, in a $3.54 billion deal that expands its reach to 80% of U.S. TV households.

headline: Comcast Supports American Small Business Growth Awarding 100 Grant Packages to Entrepreneurs in Nashville, TN
summary: Today, Comcast announced the award of 100 new grant packages in Nashville through Comcast RISE, an initiative that fuels the growth of American small businesses and helps to strengthen local communities. These grants will support entrepreneurs in Nashville and will be awarded in September 2025. headline: Comcast Supports American Small Business Growth Awarding 100 Grant Packages to Entrepreneurs in Grand Rapids & Muskegon
summary: Today, Comcast announced the award of 100 new grant packages through Comcast RISE, an initiative that fuels the growth of American small businesses and helps to strengthen local communities. headline: Nexstar to buy smaller rival Tegna for $3.54 billion in big local-TV deal
summary: (Reuters) -Nexstar Media has agreed to buy smaller rival Tegna for $3.54 billion, creating a local-TV powerhouse that seeks to compete better with Big Tech and national media for advertising dollars.  Acquiring Tegna will expand Nexstar's presence in nine of the top 10 U.S. markets, covering 80% of TV households across key geographies, including Atlanta, Phoenix and Seattle.  That could give Nexstar, the largest U.S. regional TV station operator, more leverage with advertisers and pay-TV distributors at a time when local media is grappling with falling revenue and subscriber loss because of the popularity of streaming services.

raw.headline: Nexstar to buy smaller rival Tegna for $3.54 billion in big local-TV deal
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Nexstar Media has agreed to buy smaller rival Tegna for $3.54 billion, creating a local-TV powerhouse that seeks to compete better with Big Tech and national media for advertising dollars.  Acquiring Tegna will expand Nexstar's presence in nine of the top 10 U.S. markets, covering 80% of TV households across key geographies, including Atlanta, Phoenix and Seattle.  That could give Nexstar, the largest U.S. regional TV station operator, more leverage with advertisers and pay-TV distributors at a time when local media is grappling with falling revenue and subscriber loss because of the popularity of streaming services.
